chapter.title: ⪪ Server Configuration
chapter.para: This chapter introduces the &yast; configuration module for the ⪪ server. This module can be used to set and configure mirroring credentials, ⪪ database passwords, and e-mail addresses for receiving SMT reports. The module also lets you set the ⪪ job schedule, and activate or deactivate the ⪪ service.
To configure ⪪ with ⪪ Server Configuration, follow the steps below.

step.para: Start the &yast; module SMT Server Configuration from the &yast; control center or by running yast smt-server from the command line.
To activate ⪪, toggle the Enable Subscription Management Tool Service (SMT) option in the Customer Center Access section. For more information about activating ⪪ with &yast;, see .
If the firewall is enabled, activate Open Port in Firewall.

In the Customer Center Configuration section of Customer Center Access, you can set the custom server URLs. Set and test credentials for the SUSE Update service. Correct credentials are necessary to enable mirroring from the download server and determine the products that should be mirrored. Also set the e-mail address used for the registration and the URL of your ⪪ server. For more information, see .
In the Database and Reporting section, set the password for the ⪪ user in the &mariadb; database and specify e-mail addresses for receiving reports. For more information, see and .
In the Scheduled SMT Jobs section, set a schedule for ⪪ jobs, such as synchronization of updates, &scc; registration, and ⪪ report generation. For more information, see .
If you want to abort the configuration and cancel any changes, click Cancel.

note.para: When the ⪪ Configuration applies changes, it checks whether the common server certificate exists. If the certificate does not exist, you will be asked whether the certificate should be created.

sect1.title: Activating and Deactivating ⪪ with &yast;
sect1.para: &yast; provides an easy way to activate or deactivate the ⪪ service. To activate ⪪ using &yast;, follow the steps below.

step.para: Switch to the Customer Center Access section in the ⪪ Configuration.
Activate the Enable Subscription Management Tool service (SMT) option.

note.para: Specify organization credentials before activating ⪪. For more information on how to set organization credentials with &yast;, see .

step.para: Click Finish to apply the changes and leave the ⪪ Configuration.

sect1.para: To deactivate ⪪ with &yast;, proceed as follows.

step.para: Switch to the Customer Center Access section in the ⪪ Configuration.
Disable the Enable Subscription Management Tool service (SMT) option.
Click Finish to apply the changes and leave the ⪪ Configuration.

sect1.para: When activating ⪪, &yast; performs the following actions.

listitem.para: The Apache configuration is changed by creating symbolic links in the /etc/apache2/conf.d/ directory. Links to the /etc/smt.d/nu_server.conf and /etc/smt.d/smt_mod_perl.conf files are created there.
The Apache Web server is started (or reloaded if already running).
The &mariadb; server is started or restarted. The smt user and all necessary tables in the database are created, if needed.
The schema of the ⪪ database is checked. If the database schema is outdated, the ⪪ database is upgraded to the current schema.
Cron is updated by creating a symbolic link in the /etc/cron.d/ directory. A link to the /etc/smt.d/novell.com-smt file is created there.

sect1.para: When deactivating ⪪, &yast; performs the following actions.

listitem.para: Symbolic links are created in the /etc/apache2/conf.d/, and /etc/cron.d/ directories are deleted.
The Cron daemon, the Apache server, and the &mariadb; database daemon are restarted. Neither Apache nor &mariadb; are stopped, as they may be used for other purposes than the ⪪ service.

sect1.title: Setting the Update Server Credentials with &yast;
sect1.para: The following procedure describes how set and test the download server credentials and the URL of the download server service using &yast;.

figure.title: Setting the Update Server Credentials with &yast;

step.para: Switch to the Customer Center Access section in the ⪪ Configuration. If the credentials have been already set with &yast; or via the /etc/smt.conf configuration file, they will be displayed in the User and Password fields.
If you do not have credentials, visit &scc; to obtain them. For more details, see .
Enter your user name and password in the appropriate fields.

Click Test to check the credentials. &yast; will try to download a list of available repositories with the provided
credentials. If the test succeeds, the last line of the test results will read Test result: success. If the test fails, check the provided
credentials and try again.

figure.title: Successful Test of the Update Server Credentials

step.para: Enter the SCC E-mail Used for Registration. This should be the address you used to register to &scc;.
Enter Your SMT Server URL if it has not been detected automatically.
Click OK.

sect1.title: Setting ⪪ Database Password with &yast;
sect1.para: For security reasons, ⪪ uses its own user in the database. &yast; provides an interface for setting up or changing the ⪪ database password. To set or change the ⪪ database password with &yast;, follow the steps below.

step.para: Switch to the Database and Reporting section in the ⪪ Configuration module.
Enter the Database Password for ⪪ User. Confirm the password by re-entering it, then click OK.

sect1.title: Setting E-mail Addresses to Receive Reports with &yast;
sect1.para: &yast; ⪪ provides an interface for setting up a list of e-mail addresses for receiving reports from ⪪. To edit this list of addresses, proceed as follows.

step.para: Switch to the Database and Reporting section in the ⪪ Configuration.
The list of e-mail addresses is shown in the table. Use the appropriate buttons to add, edit, and delete existing address entries.
Click OK.

sect1.para: The comma-separated list of addresses for ⪪ reports is written to the reportEmail section of the /etc/smt.conf configuration file.

sect1.title: Setting the ⪪ Job Schedule with &yast;
sect1.para: The ⪪ Configuration module provides an interface to schedule recurring ⪪ jobs. &yast; uses cron to schedule configured jobs. If needed, cron can be used directly. There are five types of recurring jobs that can be set:

listitem.para: Synchronizes with &scc;, updates repositories, and downloads new updates.
Generates and sends ⪪ Subscription Reports to addresses defined in .
Registers with &scc; all clients that are not already registered or that changed their data since the last registration.
Cleans up queued jobs. It removes finished or failed jobs from the job queue that are older than eight days. It also removes job artifacts that are left in the database as result of an error.

sect1.para: Use the following procedure to configure the schedule of ⪪ jobs with &yast;.

step.para: Switch to the Scheduled SMT Jobs section in the ⪪ Configuration. The table contains a list of all scheduled jobs, their type, frequency, date, and time to run. You can add, delete, and edit the existing scheduled tasks.
To add a scheduled ⪪ job, click Add. This opens the Adding New SMT Scheduled Job dialog.
Choose the synchronization job to schedule. You can choose between Synchronization of Updates, Report Generation, SCC Registration, and Job Queue Cleanup.
Choose the Frequency of the new scheduled ⪪ job. Jobs can be performed Daily, Weekly, Monthly, or Periodically (every n-th hour or every m-th minute).
Set the Job Start Time by entering Hour and Minute. In case a recurring job, enter the relevant intervals. For weekly and monthly schedules, select Day of the Week or Day of the Month.
Click Add.
To edit a scheduled ⪪ job (for example, change its frequency, time, or date), select the job in the table and click Edit. Change then the desired parameters and click OK.
To cancel a scheduled job and delete it from the table, select the job in the table and click Delete.
Click OK to apply the settings and quit the ⪪ Configuration.
